name: 8.21 "Bar Wars III: "The Return of Tecumseh" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Why did Frasier say he couldn't ask his parents to babysit?
options: He didn't have money to pay them.
questions.explanation:
They're dead.

	This is one of the discrepancies between "Cheers" and "Frasier". On Frasier his father, Martin, is still alive.

questions.text: Why did Woody say Mr. Clavin wasn't himself?
options: The guy down the street is yourself.
questions.explanation:
Dr. Crane is yourself.

	Cliff started to tell the bar some random fact and then decided he didn't want to tell it. The others were shocked and he said he wasn't feeling himself. Frasier then went on with some useless trivia and Woody said, "I know why you're not yourself Mr. Clavin, Dr. Crane is yourself."

questions.text: How did they misspell Cheers on the decorations?
questions.explanation:
C H E E S.

	Rebecca was not very happy that their decorations were all spelled wrong. She then said she had to go and get cheese because people would be expecting it.

questions.text: What holiday did they say was one of the busiest nights of the year?
questions.explanation:
St. Patrick's Day

	For a bar, St. Patrick's Day is a big deal. One of the favorites in the bars is green beer.

questions.text: Who do they think stole Tecumseh?
questions.explanation:
Gary.

	Gary's bar and Cheers have had a rivalry going on for years. So, it was only natural to think Gary stole Tecumseh when he was missing. Tecumseh was the name of the wooden Indian statue they had by the door of the bar just inside.

questions.text: What did Norm, Cliff, and Sam do to Gary's Olde Town Tavern?
questions.correct: shut it down on one of the busiest nights of the year
options: burnt it down to the ground
stole all the beer from the kegs
made them a sign that said Cheers served better beer
questions.explanation:
shut it down on one of the busiest nights of the year.

	They put padlocks on all the doors. They also put police tape around the building so no one would try to go in.

options: Rebecca gave him to Gary's as a present.
questions.explanation:
Rebecca had him revarnished.

	The gang told Rebecca that they shut down Gary's on the busiest night of the year for no good reason. Rebecca told them they better fix it before Gary retaliated.

questions.text: What did Woody think Gary did?
questions.explanation:
made it snow.

	The others kept yelling, "Gary didn't make it snow!" Woody, however, was convinced that Gary did indeed make it snow.

questions.text: What did the fire marshal keep saying?
questions.explanation:
What are you doing?.

	They thought that the marshal was sent by Gary as a joke. Turned out Gary didn't even know they shut the bar down so the marshal was legit.

questions.text: What did Norm, Woody, Cliff and Sam do to keep Gary from retaliating?
questions.correct: They shaved their heads to spell G-A-R-Y.
options: They gave him a hundred dollars.
They took down the police tape and took off the padlocks.
They closed down Cheers on the busiest day of the year too.
questions.explanation:
They shaved their heads to spell G-A-R-Y.

	Sam didn't actually shave his hair. He got a skull cap instead because, well it's Sam, and it's his hair. The others chased him with the intent to shave his head when they found out.
